verses.esv: 48 ‘where their worm does not die and the fire is not quenched.’
verses.kjv: 48 Where their worm dieth not, and the fire is not quenched.
verses.niv: 48 where "'their worm does not die, and the fire is not quenched.'

verses.esv: 24 “And they shall go out and look on the dead bodies of the men who have rebelled against me. For their worm shall not die, their fire shall not be quenched, and they shall be an abhorrence to all flesh.”
verses.kjv: 24 And they shall go forth, and look upon the carcases of the men that have transgressed against me: for their worm shall not die, neither shall their fire be quenched; and they shall be an abhorring unto all flesh.
verses.niv: 24 "And they will go out and look upon the dead bodies of those who rebelled against me; their worm will not die, nor will their fire be quenched, and they will be loathsome to all mankind."

verses.esv: 23 Immediately an angel of the Lord struck him down, because he did not give God the glory, and he was eaten by worms and breathed his last.
verses.kjv: 23 And immediately the angel of the Lord smote him, because he gave not God the glory: and he was eaten of worms, and gave up the ghost.
verses.niv: 23 Immediately, because Herod did not give praise to God, an angel of the Lord struck him down, and he was eaten by worms and died.

verses.esv:
6   how much less man, who is a maggot,
    and the son of man, who is a worm!”
verses.kjv: 6 How much less man, that is a worm? and the son of man, which is a worm?
verses.niv: 6 how much less man, who is but a maggot- a son of man, who is only a worm!"

verses.esv:
14   Fear not, you worm Jacob,
    you men of Israel!
  I am the one who helps you, declares the LORD;
    your Redeemer is the Holy One of Israel.
verses.kjv: 14 Fear not, thou worm Jacob, and ye men of Israel; I will help thee, saith the LORD, and thy redeemer, the Holy One of Israel.
verses.niv: 14 Do not be afraid, O worm Jacob, O little Israel, for I myself will help you," declares the LORD, your Redeemer, the Holy One of Israel.

verses.esv: 20 But they did not listen to Moses. Some left part of it till the morning, and it bred worms and stank. And Moses was angry with them.
verses.kjv: 20 Notwithstanding they hearkened not unto Moses; but some of them left of it until the morning, and it bred worms, and stank: and Moses was wroth with them.
verses.niv: 20 However, some of them paid no attention to Moses; they kept part of it until morning, but it was full of maggots and began to smell. So Moses was angry with them.

verses.esv:
6   But I am a worm and not a man,
    scorned by mankind and despised by the people.
verses.kjv: 6 But I am a worm, and no man; a reproach of men, and despised of the people.
verses.niv: 6 But I am a worm and not a man, scorned by men and despised by the people.

verses.kjv: 44 Where their worm dieth not, and the fire is not quenched.
verses.niv: 44 See Footnote

verses.esv: 7 But when dawn came up the next day, God appointed a worm that attacked the plant, so that it withered.
verses.kjv: 7 But God prepared a worm when the morning rose the next day, and it smote the gourd that it withered.
verses.niv: 7 But at dawn the next day God provided a worm, which chewed the vine so that it withered.

verses.kjv: 46 Where their worm dieth not, and the fire is not quenched.
verses.niv: 46 See Footnote

verses.esv:
11   Your pomp is brought down to Sheol,
    the sound of your harps;
  maggots are laid as a bed beneath you,
    and worms are your covers.
verses.kjv: 11 Thy pomp is brought down to the grave, and the noise of thy viols: the worm is spread under thee, and the worms cover thee.
verses.niv: 11 All your pomp has been brought down to the grave, along with the noise of your harps; maggots are spread out beneath you and worms cover you.

verses.esv: 24 So they laid it aside till the morning, as Moses commanded them, and it did not stink, and there were no worms in it.
verses.kjv: 24 And they laid it up till the morning, as Moses bade: and it did not stink, neither was there any worm therein.
verses.niv: 24 So they saved it until morning, as Moses commanded, and it did not stink or get maggots in it.

verses.esv:
26   They lie down alike in the dust,
    and the worms cover them.
verses.kjv: 26 They shall lie down alike in the dust, and the worms shall cover them.
verses.niv: 26 Side by side they lie in the dust, and worms cover them both.

verses.esv: 16 “For God so loved the world, that he gave his only Son, that whoever believes in him should not perish but have eternal life.
verses.kjv: 16 For God so loved the world, that he gave his only begotten Son, that whosoever believeth in him should not perish, but have everlasting life.
verses.niv: 16 "For God so loved the world that he gave his one and only Son, that whoever believes in him shall not perish but have eternal life.

verses.esv:
20   The womb forgets them;
    the worm finds them sweet;
  they are no longer remembered,
    so wickedness is broken like a tree.’
verses.kjv: 20 The womb shall forget him; the worm shall feed sweetly on him; he shall be no more remembered; and wickedness shall be broken as a tree.
verses.niv: 20 The womb forgets them, the worm feasts on them; evil men are no longer remembered but are broken like a tree.

verses.esv:
8   For the moth will eat them up like a garment,
    and the worm will eat them like wool,
  but my righteousness will be forever,
    and my salvation to all generations.”
verses.kjv: 8 For the moth shall eat them up like a garment, and the worm shall eat them like wool: but my righteousness shall be for ever, and my salvation from generation to generation.
verses.niv: 8 For the moth will eat them up like a garment; the worm will devour them like wool. But my righteousness will last forever, my salvation through all generations."

verses.esv:
17   they shall lick the dust like a serpent,
    like the crawling things of the earth;
  they shall come trembling out of their strongholds;
    they shall turn in dread to the LORD our God,
    and they shall be in fear of you.
verses.kjv: 17 They shall lick the dust like a serpent, they shall move out of their holes like worms of the earth: they shall be afraid of the LORD our God, and shall fear because of thee.
verses.niv: 17 They will lick dust like a snake, like creatures that crawl on the ground. They will come trembling out of their dens; they will turn in fear to the LORD our God and will be afraid of you.

verses.esv:
26   And after my skin has been thus destroyed,
    yet in my flesh I shall see God,
verses.kjv: 26 And though after my skin worms destroy this body, yet in my flesh shall I see God:
verses.niv: 26 And after my skin has been destroyed, yet in my flesh I will see God;

verses.esv: 39 You shall plant vineyards and dress them, but you shall neither drink of the wine nor gather the grapes, for the worm shall eat them.
verses.kjv: 39 Thou shalt plant vineyards, and dress them, but shalt neither drink of the wine, nor gather the grapes; for the worms shall eat them.
verses.niv: 39 You will plant vineyards and cultivate them but you will not drink the wine or gather the grapes, because worms will eat them.

verses.esv: 38 And Peter said to them, “Repent and be baptized every one of you in the name of Jesus Christ for the forgiveness of your sins, and you will receive the gift of the Holy Spirit.
verses.kjv: 38 Then Peter said unto them, Repent, and be baptized every one of you in the name of Jesus Christ for the remission of sins, and ye shall receive the gift of the Holy Ghost.
verses.niv: 38 Peter replied, "Repent and be baptized, every one of you, in the name of Jesus Christ for the forgiveness of your sins. And you will receive the gift of the Holy Spirit.

verses.esv:
25   I will restore to you the years
    that the swarming locust has eaten,
  the hopper, the destroyer, and the cutter,
    my great army, which I sent among you.
verses.kjv: 25 And I will restore to you the years that the locust hath eaten, the cankerworm, and the caterpiller, and the palmerworm, my great army which I sent among you.
verses.niv: 25 "I will repay you for the years the locusts have eaten- the great locust and the young locust, the other locusts and the locust swarm - my great army that I sent among you.

verses.esv: 20 Now Herod was angry with the people of Tyre and Sidon, and they came to him with one accord, and having persuaded Blastus, the king’s chamberlain, they asked for peace, because their country depended on the king’s country for food. 21 On an appointed day Herod put on his royal robes, took his seat upon the throne, and delivered an oration to them. 22 And the people were shouting, “The voice of a god, and not of a man!” 23 Immediately an angel of the Lord struck him down, because he did not give God the glory, and he was eaten by worms and breathed his last.
verses.kjv: 20 And Herod was highly displeased with them of Tyre and Sidon: but they came with one accord to him, and, having made Blastus the king’s chamberlain their friend, desired peace; because their country was nourished by the king’s country. 21 And upon a set day Herod, arrayed in royal apparel, sat upon his throne, and made an oration unto them. 22 And the people gave a shout, saying, It is the voice of a god, and not of a man. 23 And immediately the angel of the Lord smote him, because he gave not God the glory: and he was eaten of worms, and gave up the ghost.
verses.niv: 20 Then Herod went from Judea to Caesarea and stayed there a while. He had been quarreling with the people of Tyre and Sidon; they now joined together and sought an audience with him. Having secured the support of Blastus, a trusted personal servant of the king, they asked for peace, because they depended on the king's country for their food supply. 21 On the appointed day Herod, wearing his royal robes, sat on his throne and delivered a public address to the people. 22 They shouted, "This is the voice of a god, not of a man." 23 Immediately, because Herod did not give praise to God, an angel of the Lord struck him down, and he was eaten by worms and died.

verses.esv: 22 But I say to you that everyone who is angry with his brother will be liable to judgment; whoever insults his brother will be liable to the council; and whoever says, ‘You fool!’ will be liable to the hell of fire.
verses.kjv: 22 But I say unto you, That whosoever is angry with his brother without a cause shall be in danger of the judgment: and whosoever shall say to his brother, Raca, shall be in danger of the council: but whosoever shall say, Thou fool, shall be in danger of hell fire.
verses.niv: 22 But I tell you that anyone who is angry with his brother will be subject to judgment. Again, anyone who says to his brother, 'Raca, 'is answerable to the Sanhedrin. But anyone who says, 'You fool!' will be in danger of the fire of hell.

verses.esv:
5   My flesh is clothed with worms and dirt;
    my skin hardens, then breaks out afresh.
verses.kjv: 5 My flesh is clothed with worms and clods of dust; my skin is broken, and become loathsome.
verses.niv: 5 My body is clothed with worms and scabs, my skin is broken and festering.

verses.esv:
14   if I say to the pit, ‘You are my father,’
    and to the worm, ‘My mother,’ or ‘My sister,’
verses.kjv: 14 I have said to corruption, Thou art my father: to the worm, Thou art my mother, and my sister.
verses.niv: 14 if I say to corruption, 'You are my father,' and to the worm, 'My mother' or 'My sister,'
